template_data.alt: A star elf with pale skin and uncanny, hairless features. She wears a yellow jacket with a tree symbol on the breast. Behind her, there is a strange looming figure fading into gray mist. She steps on glass surfaces along the inside of a well, from which black tendrils seem to emerge.

Behind her, there is a strange looming figure fading into gray mist. She steps on glass surfaces along the inside of a well, from which black tendrils seem to emerge.|thumb|Delphe standing before the well, using her magic to quell a breach.]]
document_data.caption: Delphe and Cynosure quelling an outbreak
document_data.name: Delphe
document_data.mainbody:
{{quote|''All's well in the well.''|Keeper Delphe}}

'''Delphe''' was a [[star elf]] [[abjurer]]{{cite book/Stardeep|96-101|9}} and a [[Keeper of the Cerulean Sign]].{{cite book/Stardeep|286-289|28}}
document_data.Personality: Delphe was reassured by her little superstitions, often murmuring "All's well in the Well" when nothing had happened.{{cite book/Stardeep|2-11|1}}
document_data.Activities: Delphe was in charge of the [[Stardeep#Inner Bastion|Inner Bastion]] of [[Stardeep]]. and of monitoring [[Stardeep#The Well|The Well]] in particular.
document_data.Equipment: Delphe once possessed a [[Cerulean Sign]], an amulet with potent magical powers against elder [[aberration]]s though it was destroyed in [[1375 DR]] by [[Telarian]] using the sword [[Nis|Angul-Nis]].
document_data.Relationships:
She considered Cynosure too unimaginative, and Telarian too humorless, though the former could make her laugh sometimes. There was some friction between her and Telarian from when a few years before, she'd been chosen to wield the Sign instead of him.

Eventually, she came to school [[Raidon Kane]] on the use of his bonded Cerulean Sign.
document_data.Abilities: Delphe specialized in [[abjuration]]. Amongst the spells she could call upon quickly were ''[[wall of force]]'', ''[[lightning bolt]]'', and a version of ''[[black blade of disaster]]'' which she knew as a ''spellscythe''.
document_data.Rumors: Telarian accused her of being the one that had been subverted by the Traitor when he was talking to Kiril Duskmourn.{{cite book/Stardeep|265-267|25}}
